meaning: Things must keep moving or they spoil.

textDari: نیکی کن و در دجله انداز
textPashto: ښه وکړه او سیند ته یې واچوه
translationEn: Do good and throw it into the river
meaning: Do good deeds without expecting reward.

textPashto: په کراره لاړ شه، خو تل لاړ شه
د تورې شپې پای، روڼ سهار وي
translationEn: The end of a dark night is bright

textDari: هر که طاووس خواهد، جور هندوستان کشد
textPashto: چا ته چې طاووس خوښ وي، د هند سفر به کوي
translationEn: He who wants a peacock must endure the trip to India
meaning: You must suffer to achieve beauty or success.

textPashto: څاه کونکی به خامخا پکې ولویږي
translationEn: He who digs a pit will eventually fall in it
meaning: Harming others will come back to you.

textDari: از تو حرکت، از خدا برکت
textPashto: ته خوښی وکړه، خدا به برکت درکړي
translationEn: You make the move, God gives the blessing
meaning: Effort is necessary to receive blessings.

textPashto: یوه ګل نه پسرلی نه کېږي
translationEn: One flower doesn’t make a spring
meaning: One effort alone is not enough.

textDari: سیلی نقد به از حلوای نسیه
textPashto: نقده څپېړه د پور حلوا نه ښه ده
translationEn: A slap now is better than a sweet later
meaning: Something certain now is better than a promise for later.

textDari: هر که بام‌اش بیش، برف‌اش بیشتر
textPashto: چا چې بام لوړ وي، واوره به هم ډېره پرې وي
translationEn: The higher the roof, the heavier the snow
meaning: With greater possessions or status comes greater responsibility or trouble.
